channel.title: Strings
channel.description: I am curios as to how strings work. I know what they do, but not how to use them. I see lots of: command.substring(7) command.substring(8) command.substring(9) command.substring(10) _____ Mainly what I'm asking is what is the (7) and what not at the end for. I never know what number to use :P. Thanks.

item.title: Strings
item.dc:creator: @yeoldhag yeoldhag
item.description:
@yeoldhag wrote:

Thanks much, more simple then I thought it’d be.

Read full topic

item.title: Strings
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Take this for example:

if (command.startsWith("banuser") && playerRights >= 1) { String victim = command.substring(8);

The word ‘banuser’ has 7 letters, plus a space at the end since you will adding the player’s name after it. That’s where the 8 comes from.

Read full topic

item.description:
@yeoldhag wrote:

I am curios as to how strings work. I know what they do, but not how to use them. I see lots of:
command.substring(7)
command.substring(8)
command.substring(9)
command.substring(10)

Mainly what I’m asking is what is the (7) and what not at the end for. I never know what number to use :P. Thanks.
